definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Tabb is the first woman to referee a world snooker championship final.
sentences.chinese: 塔普是第一位在斯诺克世锦赛决赛中担当裁判的女性。

sentences.english: Liu Xiang spearheads Team China to Daegu meet.
sentences.chinese: 刘翔领衔中国队出征大邱世锦赛。

sentences.english: Payne was delighted to have added Olympic silver to his world bronze.
sentences.chinese: 佩恩对世锦赛铜牌加奥运银牌的成绩感到非常高兴。

sentences.english: Hong won the silver at the 2007 world championships.
sentences.chinese: 在2007年的世锦赛中，洪淑贞赢得了银牌。

sentences.english: Agents will raise the issue of prize-money for next year's world championships.
sentences.chinese: 经纪人将提出下年度世锦赛奖金的问题。

sentences.english: Chinese strikes 2 golds in swimming worlds.
sentences.chinese: 世锦赛中国获得游泳金牌2块。

sentences.english: Yang Wei also won two men’s individual all-around gold medals at the Artistic Gymnastics World Championships.
sentences.chinese: 杨威还获得过两次世锦赛体操个人全能冠军。

sentences.english: You didn't participate in World Basketball Classic. What do you think about the results of Team USA?
sentences.chinese: 你没有参加世锦赛，你怎么看待米国队的成绩？

sentences.english: The city will host the next world athletics championships in 2011.
sentences.chinese: 大邱是2011年田径世锦赛的举办地。

definition: abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
abbr. for 全國運動會|全国运动会[Quan2 guo2 Yun4 dong4 hui4]
abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
